Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: FinlandFinn
Reviews.Content: I stayed a long weekend in Istanbul in the March 2012. I had a three night stay at Hotel Evsen. It was my first journey to this town, but not the last one. Before my journey I read very many good reviews about this hotel, so I decided to book a room from there. I made my room booking via internet travel agency and chose in the beginning the standard room with quite cheap price. After I read some Tripadvisor recommendations I changed my room to deluxe one with small balcony and a view to the street. It was late Friday evening when I came to the old town in Istanbul. I came to the city from AtatÃ¼rk airport by metro and by tram. The nearest tram stop to the hotel is GÃ¼lhane. The hotel is located about 200 meters from the tram stop but for me it took a few moments to find the hotel, because the there were not any lights on the hotel sign. The location of the hotel was nice. During the evenings and night times the old city is peaceful and quiet area. But If you would like to have an active night life in the bars the old city is not the best area for that. In that case you should maybe choose the hotel from BeyoÄŸlu area. But for me the hotel location in old town was perfect. All the major sights were in the walking distance. The reception personnel in the hotel were warm and welcoming. But the deluxe room was a quite disappointment for me. The room was clean and updated. But the size of the room was very small. I am not sure that the change from the standard room to a deluxe one was worth of it. Even the room was renovated there were still few small things where you noticed that the room needs either more renovation or quality of renovation made was not the best one (f. ex in the bathroom). Also the locking of the room door was not the perfect one (the locks are very easy to broken). In the room there were wifi (from the wifi unit from the corridor), tv and heat pump air conditioning unit available. Also there were empty and quite dirty and non working mini fridge. The breakfast was included in the room price. Breakfast room was located next to the reception desk. The breakfast room was very small but surprisingly not very crowded during the breakfast hours. The buffet breakfast included some tomatoes, cheese, bread, cold cuts, coffee, tea and fruits. As a summary I should say that my stay in this hotel was ok. Anyway, maybe I expected that deluxe room would be much better than it actually was (because the price of the deluxe room was much higher comparing to standard one). It would have been nice to see the quality of the standard rooms. The town of Istanbul was very nice and safe. I will go there again, but next time I will choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “April 2012 at Hotel Evsen”
Reviews.Author: Sam H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a lovely week at the Hotel Evsen just after Easter. The down side of this hotel is that the rooms are very small, and the cheaper rooms like the one we took offer no view from the windows. Everything else I can say, however, is quite positive: the location within easy walking distance of the major tourist attractions is superb, rooms are very clean and quiet, room amenities are respectable. We had a good bed, entirely adequate shower, slept well. Best of all is the very friendly, well informed staff. The hotel manager is a bright and engaging young man, and receptionists Jamola, Guckan (no idea how to spell his name), and Murat speak excellent English and are consistently helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good staff”
Reviews.Author: 1ayub
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a week for a twin room the Hotel Evsun is a very clean hotel and the staff were very helpful aspecially Gokhan who on arrival gave us a drink and a turkish sweet he spoke very good english he also gave excellent ideas and information of places of interst in istanbul Breakfast buffet was nice the best thing about the hotel is that it was 5-10 minutes walk from the blue mosque and other places of interst in sultanamet and 2 minutes from the metro stop gulhane The cleaners cleaned the room daily and their were always fesh towles put in and rubbbish taken away. There is wifi and the tv had lots of european channels we would recommend this hotel and if we are to come again to istanbul we will book this as it was value for money AND THE STAFF WERE BRILLIANT

Reviews.Title: “Good location and staff BUT”
Reviews.Author: hunter79
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The room was a deluxe room but only had about half a meter around the double bed and the tiniest shower room possible so not for those of you looking for luxury. The hotel is modern, clean and tidy and our room was cleaned everyday. The staff are really friendly and try to help so it makes it diffiicult to get upset with them. We did have lots of issues which could have been avoided and that would have meant a much better stay-we booked our cab from the airport to the hotel via the hotel but they sent the cab to the wrong airport so we waited for 90minutes at the airport and still paid the premium price which was not a good start. On the next day we booked for dinner at a fish restaurant that they recommended but we never got picked up and after 45minutes of waiting we made our way to another restaurant. Even our trip back via shuttle bus to the airport was crazy-we were picked up late so we got stuck in traffic and got there late and had to rush to make the flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: girlfriday989
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Evsen for 4 nights. We had a 'luxury' room with French balcony. The room was no more than 7.5m2. Very small! As our balcony was directly over reception, if we opened our balcony door, the room was filled with cigarette smoke from people smoking outside the hotel as smoking is not allowed inside so ask for a room higher up. We did but the hotel was fully booked and we were offered an upgrade for 40 euros per night! The location is excellent. Close to all tourist attractions and the tram at Gulhane. Staff were very friendly. Breakfast was basic but adequate. The shower in our room leaked badly every time we used it which meant the bathroom floor was very wet. The rooms are basic but clean. I would possibly stay again but request a room on a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice if you stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Irchiks
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in very comfortable place as you can visit the Old part of the town easily by foot, as well as can get somewhere further by tram. Hotel has good service. Rooms are small and at hardly any room have window, so it is a bit not comfortable cos when sleeping it is hot. Can be switched air conditioner but this means you have to sleep near it. But otherwise the hotel is very nice, friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel location and adorable staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ianpborges
Reviews.Content: We had great time on this very simple but confortable hotel. Great location next to all the main attraction on the old city by foot. Regular breakfast and AMAZING staff. All people we talked to were very attentive, helpful and available! I really recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best decision made”
Reviews.Author: Jesse H
Reviews.Content: With its overwhelming location, cozy rooms and friendly staff, Hotel Evsen is the best decision to be made. Me and my family were very pleased during our trip to Istanbul. Thanks to its great location we reached all transportations easily and didn't have any trouble while visiting other historical and cultural places. Sirkeci is a heritage by itself so Hotel Evsen gave us the advantage to relax at its cozy lobby while enjoying the beauty of Istanbul. Thanks again for their hospitality. For our next trip to Istanbul, Hotel Evsen will be our first choice again

Reviews.Title: “Evsen.. you rock! A 3-star Hotel with a 5-star service”
Reviews.Author: Mariam M
Reviews.Content: a VERY VERY clean hotel with VERY helpful staff speaking English (which is something rare in Turkey), the hotel location is perfect for most of the sightseeing.. you can walk or target 'Gulhane' tram station which is few blocks from Evsen Hotel. The tiny rooms weren't that much annoying as I thought before, you'll get used to it, don't worry :) We were pampered since the moment we left Ataturk airport, a car was waiting for us at the airport, transfered us to the hotel. We were welcomed with a big smile, a nice drink and one of the staff had given us a map of Istanbul, explained every single location on that map, it really helped me alot. The staff has the answers of all my questions, just ask them what goes on your mind. I had a problem with the WIFI signal on the THIRD floor where I stayed, the problem was solved the following day. Do not expect much from the breakfast... just remember how much you paid and you'll be sooooo satisfied like what i did. You'd find variety of food like : bread, 2 kind of cheese, boiled eggs, vegetables, olives, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, milk, cereal, 3 kind of jam, honey, butter, & cake. Evsen Hotel is very quiet, you'd definitely enjoy a deep sleep after a very tiring day. BIG THANKS for offering us those hot drinks in a that freezing night, you totally read our minds & it was a very remarkable action from you guys, chapeau! EVSEN HOTEL... wait for my next visit, in sha' uluh so soon ;)

Reviews.Title: “Usmon from Malaysia”
Reviews.Author: Malaysia U
Reviews.Content: I was in Turkey last year for a week! My company asked me to stay in Evsen Hotel during my business trip! Evsen Hotel is very pleased with the cleanliness, quality and fresh material is used (sheets and towels), friendliness of staff needs to be appreciated. Everything is on time and services are standby!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome city trip !”
Reviews.Author: LeylaBby
Reviews.Content: Nice , clean hotel.. super friendly staff, Great hospitality !!! Sure we'll come again !!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: Arineg
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to relax and forget about everyday rutine. Hotel has excellent location, close to all tourist atractions. Food is just delicious...:)And staff at the hotel so helpful and kind. Ive stayed there with my child so of course there is always something to ask for, hehehe. Nice, polite and really friendly people. Rooms are clean and price reasonable. Would come back there for sure!enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: T K
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful staff, good location close to all tourist points and the ferries, good value for money, clean rooms and OK breakfast. The only weak point are the walls in the rooms - they really are very thin.

Reviews.Title: “Pro service, perfect location, delicious foods, and the most important very reasonable price...Excellent quality I advÄ±se everyb”
Reviews.Author: larammm
Reviews.Content: Ä± worked as a hotel controler for a long times, traveled all over world and I saw all kÄ±nd of hotels. This place worth to stay because excellent service, nice rooms, perfect location, delicious food and very reasonable price. We left very happy from there, felt like we are in home. I advice everybody to stay there ....

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Stunnig
Reviews.Content: Ä° had great time. Ä°t was live up to My expectation. Hotels staff were very friendly. The hotel was very clean. I am planing to stay there again when l go to turkey

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: oliv86
Reviews.Content: Starting with the location which was really great next to Aya Sofia and all the ancient buildings.Many restaurants and coffee shop and only 10min on foot to Kapalicarsi.The train station one block after the hotel takes you everywhere even to the airport.The room of the hotel was very clean and beautiful.But you have to know that also was very small but I liked so much.The staff was very friendly and unbelievable friendly.The rates was really very cheap.The only thing I didn't like was the breakfast.They had only cake,orange juice and tea.They didn't served coffee!!!

Reviews.Title: “Evsen review”
Reviews.Author: nupsy1
Reviews.Content: - we stayed in a "Deluxe double-bed" room in the first week of Jan 2012. - The room & bathroom were tiny but the hotel location more than makes up for it, particularly if you do not plan to spend much time in the room. - Within 10-15 minutes walk from just about all the major tourist sites such the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Spice Bazaar, Hodja Pasha shows, and Grand Bazaar. - located on a relatively quiet street lined with restaurants; 5 min walk to a Tram station. - high marks to the service folks who were very polite and helpful. - daily breakfast from 7-10 am had a decent spread. - free unlimited internet access. - Taxi from the airport had difficulty finding the hotel, so would recommend coming along with info on directions (just in case). On the way back, we took a shuttle bus from the hotel to the airport (6 euros/person). - Overall, we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Miniature room but still good value”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: I paid 35 euros for my single room through www.wotif.com It was on the fourth floor: it had a double bed and had clearly been renovated in the last five years. There were ongoing renovations to another room on the third floor (I think) that ceased rather late at 2000, but this failed top disturb me as I was mostly out. The breakfast was reasonable and availed in a nice setting with a view of a minaret. The bathroom was verz small but the water was hot. Staff attitude was excellent. I stored my luggage without any problems. It was about 250 metres from Sirkecki railway station and closer still to the light rail (or major tram) line.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place Great Value”
Reviews.Author: bahadir68
Reviews.Content: i have been staying at Hotel Evsen whenever i go to Istanbul The hotel is very nice , clean and tidy. Staff is very friendly and helpful Location is great in the heart of the historical city and very close to business centers . I m strongly advice the people who are looking for a place to stay in Istanbul either business or vacation .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: srohaini7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice even though its a small but very comfortable. The location is nice and is easy to go other attraction in just a walking distance. The staff are very nice and friendly even have suggested few places to visit and guided us how to go the places. We are very happy in our stays there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jenny L
Reviews.Content: I was only in Istanbul for a weekend so Evsen was perfect for this. They arranged a shuttle to pick me up and drop me off at the airport. The rooms were small but I only needed it to sleep for a few hours so it was no problem. It's conveniently located by the tram. Walking distance to many attractions. I would definitely consider going back if I'm in Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very basic facilities”
Reviews.Author: Sawmanr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a really good area. Three minutes away from a tram stop and a few minutes walk to the main historical buildings. There are also a lot of nice restaurants and cafes in the neighborhood. The staff is very nice and attentive. I liked being welcomed at the check in with a small appetizer. On the downside, as mentioned in other comments about the hotel, the size of the room that we were given which was extremely small. The bed, which had a decent size for two and was comfortable, occupied almost the whole room and there wasnâ€™t room enough to leave our clothes in the tiny wardrobe. Our room didnâ€™t have a window and the toilette reminded an airplane. Also, the pipes system of the building must be really old because whenever our neighbors took a shower we could hear them as if they were doing so in our room. It was not nice to have to take a cold shower two of the four days that our stay lasted because according to the person at the reception, when there are too many people taking a shower at the same time, the heater canâ€™t cope with it. Breakfast was not impressive. Very basic and only instant coffee available. I still recommend this hotel if you are going to spend most of your time outdoors visiting the city and just need a place to sleep, otherwise maybe it is better to look for another option. There are plenty of hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: I spend a few days in Evsen, Istanbul. The hotel is situated in a perfect surrounding, all the interesting things and also the harbour are very near, you need no cable or taxi. The staff of the hotel is very friendly and if you need help they help you. The breakfast is very good. My next stay in Istanbul will be the Evsen again. And special thanks to SongÃ¼l ;-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: mahmood69
Reviews.Content: i've been in hotel evsen with my wife.it was a short istanbul stay for us.we were so lucky because location was amazing, it was in the city.so most of the time we walked around.open buffet breakfast was delicious also a lots of choices.our room was very good for price and it was very clean specially bathroom.i couldn't find any hair on the floor or somewhere else. and last few words for staff, they showed us turkish hospitality.they were so helpful whenever needed.also they were very smiley. now whenever i go to istanbul i always go this friendly enviroment.and i'm offering my friends as well.thank you for good work :)

Reviews.Title: “adventure”
Reviews.Author: VonFrosti
Reviews.Content: Hotel Evsen has already been twice to my choice while traveling to Istanbul. my first trip was in 2010 and the experience was really good. comfortable and friendly service, clean and quiet rooms. I think the price is very cheap, compared to the area and the level of the hotel. in 2011 I took flights to Istanbul without having booked hotels, traveled by metro from the airport near the blue mosque. I booked a hotel X ..and one night in a shady place was enough for me, so I walked to the hotel Evsen, I got a room and a warm reception, in the future I will book a hotel Evsen an early stage because of the popularity is growing, I highly recommend this hotel, good public transportation, restaurants, attractions, shopping locations near you. I have a lot of good memories of Istanbul. and one important thing is the "home" a place where you can be at peace and rest :).

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for good price”
Reviews.Author: Sabina_Ri297516
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had a 7 nights stay.Room had very small window, that looked right into the wall, so it had no use actually,but it was clean and comfort.Very low noise from outside, but isolation is awful-every single sound from other rooms is heard-elevator, walking through hall, talking. We didn't like the breakfast, it was quite poor, little breads they baked were raw inside,no fruits was offered, no real coffee but granules-coffee... but staff of hotel was very kind, accessible and ready to help us in any time if we needed anything. I think this is quite good hotel for it's price, especially for bed Ë›& breakfast staying.

Reviews.Title: “Free slippers!”
Reviews.Author: PETF
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in Istanbul for a few days and you'd like to spend not too much, but at the same time to be in a great position to visit the city, we suggest you this solution. Be careful, and ask for a room with french balcony, because the other ones are absolutely tiny, and you would not hold on for more than a night. The staff is really kind and helpful, and they will let you deposit all your money in a safety box at the reception (there won't be one in your room!). Breakfast is a little poor (with fresh orange juice not included in the fare!) but this won't be a problem in a city like Istanbul, where you'll find delicious and cheap food at every corner of the streets... Hotel Evsen will surely contribute making your experience in Istanbul a little more unforgettable (with free slippers in every room!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: goddycy
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival in Istanbul we decided we wanted to get to the hotel by using public transportation instead of a taxi. The tram stops very close to the hotel and we had no trouble finding it. The staff went out of their way to make our staying there a pleasurable experience. Not only the guide us to the tourists attractions they adviced us on how to behave in any occassion. The hotel is so near to everything we didnt have to use any tram or bus. Sure the room wasnt huge bt it was big enough to accomodate our needs. Only downfall was the wi-fi! Very weak signal in our room. But at the rest of the hotel signal was ok. The breakfast wasnt very rich but i wouldnt mind since i only have coffee in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget stay”
Reviews.Author: Naila1
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at this hotel in April and I was pleasantly surprised considering some of the other reviews on here. We found the room to be perfect for the price we paid and honestly couldn't have asked for more; there was even free wifi. The hotel staff were so friendly and made us feel very welcome. The staff helped us with directions and gave us maps when we needed them. There's plently of places to eat nearby, supermarkets and even a pharmacy. The tram station is only a short walk away, and local attractions including the blue mosque and aga sofia are also within walking distance. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is on a budget and wants to be close to the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms without window???”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend this hotel.I stayed only 1 night because of i can't breath in room.Staff was ok and they try to help.Breakfast was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but terrible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: M_Didius
Reviews.Content: First the positives: the location is brilliant, within easy walking distance of all the main sights; the staff are friendly and helpful and spoke good English; and the breakfast is a definite plus - a buffet with a good selection of tasty stuff. But!!!! The negative: The inside rooms are small (I mean tiny!) and have no natural light at all. Essentially an 8ft by 8ft box with a double bed taking up most of the floor and very little storage space. The shower/toilet is even more cramped. I'm not big but I had difficulty getting to the wash basin without twisting sideways. As mentioned in other reviews the walls are thin and all the sound carries from the next door rooms. The front rooms looking onto the street may be better but there are only four of these out of 24 so you have only one chance in six of getting one of them! I suppose it may be ok for a few nights if all you want to do is sleep in it and you do not mind confined spaces but there is no way I would recommend this hotel. A shame as it did not live up to the many "very" positive reviews we had read before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and very good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Mala-od-palube
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August in a standard double room. Slightly cramped, but very clean and quiet. The staff were very professional, helpful and friendly. The hotel is very close to Gulhane Tram Station (about a minute walk), from which you can take a tram to Taksim area or the Grand Bazar. Evsen is also very close to some of the main sights such as Sirkeci Train Station, Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Galata Bridge, and Suleymaniye Mosque. Buffet breakfast was adequate and there was something for everyone. I found this hotel to be great value for money for this location in Istanbul, and on this basis I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: Liebrefania
Reviews.Content: Evsen hotel i think is the best hotel if dont want to spend a lot of money and be so close to historical monuments.The staff was excellent the rooms very clean although they are not so big the room service very good everything was perfect.i think it deserves to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “everything we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Dilek A
Reviews.Content: my brother and i stayed in the hotel for two nights in August en route to cyprus and loved the hotel. it provided us with everything we needed. the staff were great, especially in arranging with our transfers to and from the airport, which was a concern of mine. staff was great, and very helpful. the breakfast buffet definitely hit the spot, and was a good way to start our days. yes the rooms were small, but they had everything we needed. the only thing missing in our room was a safety box, but other than that everything was pretty standard and to our liking. the location of the hotel was amazing. walked to pretty much most of the tourist sites. and the tram is 5 minute walk for longer journeys. suffice to say i recommend the hotel, and the next time i am in Istanbul i will definitely look into staying here again. -Dilek. p.s if you can get the french balcony room do it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to stay while exploring the city!”
Reviews.Author: olga_vorobiova
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Evsen hotel for 3 nights in August 2011. The aim of our coming to Istanbul was to explore the city â€“ to go sightseeing, to visit places of interest and to enjoy the beauties of this wonderful city. So we were not planning to spend a lot of time in the hotel that is why I was not seeking for a luxurious 5-star one with a swimming pool and restaurant on the roof. We needed only a place to sleep and to take shower :-) So on our arrival to Evsen hotel we were agreeably surprised to find a very nice modern hotel just in the very heart of Istanbul. The hotel has an advantageous location: 2 minutes from GÃ¼lhane station and right in the center of tourist attractions - Blue Mosque, Hippodrome, Hagia Sophia, TopkapÄ± Palace, Basilica Cistern, Archeological Museum as well as Sirkeci, New Mosque, Egyptian Bazaar, Galata bridge etc. Everything is within a 5-10 min walk. The hotel is really neat and clean. The rooms are small but very comfortable with all the necessary amenities: satellite TV, refrigerator with the mini bar, air-conditioner (which we actually hadnâ€™t expected for the price we paid for the room), free Wi-Fi, 24 hrs hot water, hairdryer, shampoo and soap, sleepers, room cleaning every day. Maybe the only thing missing as compared to other hotels is a kettle. But as there are plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area you would not probably used it anyway :-) Iâ€™ve read that some people complain about having no daylight in the roomâ€¦ Maybe there are some rooms without windows in the hotel, but these are probably the cheapest ones. As the prices in the hotel are quite reasonable I think a window (or a balcony as in our case) is worth 5 euro extra :-) Breakfast in the hotel didnâ€™t surprise us with the variety of food but was really nice and could satisfy different tastes: fried eggs, several types of bread, two sorts of cheese, vegetables, watermelon, muesli, some kind of cake, butter, jam, honey, tea, coffee and milk. And I am sure that even those people who got used to a greater variety at breakfast buffet in 5 star hotels would 100 % be loaded up in Evsen. And of course, I cannot but underline the fact that the multilingual staff in Evsen hotel is very friendly and hospitable! So in general the hotel surpassed all our expectations and left an extremely pleasant impression. If some day I come back to Istanbul, I will definitely stay in Evsen!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: BellaAthena
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 3:00am (morning!) greeted at the door by the nightstaff. Provided with cherry juice and biscuits. Took our luggage to our door for us. Breakfast was typical cold meats, cheese and fruit. Ample amounts. The room was TINY! Good thing we were only in it to sleep. But with a minibar which was awesome for a nice cold drink after sightseeing. The amazing thing was the service. We have travelled a fair bit and the helpfulness of the staff is definitely something to share. They answered every question and gave us good local information. For that level of service, and it's location in Sultanahmet (nice private road), I will definitely return to and recommend Hotel Evsen.

Reviews.Title: “It's really really nice hotel and the personnel is wouaaaa.....”
Reviews.Author: ben77310
Reviews.Content: Hey I want say , this hotel is really nice for different reason: - the emplacement is really in center in Istanbul - The personal is really nice, and always present for you, for you pleasure for give good informations, - the rooms are so nice, every day you have your bed nice, the bathroom too.... - the price is REALLY not expansive ( We stayed 6 days) :)) - and again reason more better than the last..... I want say for finish, I recommend this hotel .... We we'll be back sure..... Big kiss for evsen hotel. (Excuse me for my english not not good)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service on the fone”
Reviews.Author: Mahroof
Reviews.Content: I emailed this hotel for my parents to arrange transport from the airport and I have had prompt response! Excellet service on the phone ... I shall find out what the hotel and location is like once my parents are back from Istanbul ... But 1 st impressions via email I would say it makes me want to go and stay!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, top quality service-we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: mtarik_1
Reviews.Content: This was a very cute small family run hotel. The rooms are very basic, our first room was very small and an odd shape so was difficult with the luggage, but luckily we were upgraded to a larger better room on the last night which was more comfortable. rooms were very clean and comfortable otherwise. Breakfast options were of an excellent quality compared to other places we've stayed in. Saying this, you could not hope for a better location so the room size was not an issue-very very close to main tourist sights of Istanbul old town from the Blue Mosque to the Eqyptian Market. Very easy to be out all day, and just arrive back to collapse in bed! Service is unparalled. The staff could not have done more to make our stay comfortable and were very knowledgeable and hopeful about local sights, best places to eat and visit etc. My mum mentioned in passing she was looking for a particular book, only to find Melis (one of the staff) had found it in a local store online for us! Felt very very welcomed and comfortable. we're all absolutely in love with Istanbul (I challange you to visit and not fall in love!) and are definitily returning to hotel evsen!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: teo13
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 night in this hotel and absuletly recommend it to eveyone. Stuff is very friendly. I received one of the best service in a hotel. Location is very convenient. It is "the" place to stay if you want to be close to old city

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: SeattleShutterbug
Reviews.Content: The staff made a friend of me during a brief stay last year; I was eager to return and stay longer, and they made my holiday in Istanbul even better than I could have hoped. I booked my first stay for two nights through an online travel site that rhymes with "Mexpedia" ... When I checked in at the hotel, they informed me that despite their multiple attempts to contact "Mexpedia," they only had a room for ONE night, as the Gran Prix was in town. They called hotels in my price range and checked repeatedly, but were unable to find me another room, so they set me up with the comfortable sofa in their tidy lobby. This time, I booked through their Web site directly, and was gifted with FREE private transport to the airport after my holiday. The room is basic -- FREE INTERNET, a bed, shower, toilet and sink, and TV -- but I wasn't in Istanbul to spend time in my hotel. Friends also visiting at the time spent 3x more on their rooms, which were farther away from the trams/metro and major sights. The lobby was a great place to browse the web, edit photos, and visit with the staff (I was offered tea, juice, coffee every time I came down to work). So, save your money for silk and carpets, and stay at the Evsen -- I'll be back again for certain,

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, friendly staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Raigne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. We got a room with a french balcony which was basically useless but gave nice light to the room. It was a small room. Not a lot of moving around or if you have big bags it could be a problem. The bed was comfortable, clean sheets and they gave us nice extra blankets when we were cold. The staff was friendly, kind and very helpful. They know when things are open, and were able help us when our booked tour never showed up! I would stay here again. It is so close to the train and we walked everywhere it is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 5 sleepless nights - cannot recommend it”
Reviews.Author: violinmusic
Reviews.Content: First the positives - the location is good, close to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, and it has lots of cheap restaurants near by. I suppose at 65 euros a night it is not expensive. Also offers free internet. However, the rooms are really, really tiny. The walls are so thin that you can hear every move your neighbour makes, and vice-versa. Besides, they start vacuuming and cleaning the halls pretty early in the morning, and if you're on a vacation, you don't want to be woken up by 7 or 8 on a Saturday! If you're a light sleeper like me, it's really not a good choice. The breakfast is not good, and the service was really terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate price in super location”
Reviews.Author: GundayHuseyin
Reviews.Content: One of my friend recommended Hotel Evsen to me.. I stayed there for 3 nights and I am totaly satisfied with it. Rooms have enough size, the open buffet breakfast had wide range of goods.. Room is clean and they change the sheets everyday.. It Ä±s centrally located and easy to travel around all Old City Sultanahmet.. I recommend Hotel Evsen to every single person who looks for a city hotel because Ä±t is not worthwhile to expect more actions in such boutique hotel.. Finally the staff is so helpful they answered my 100 questions wÄ±thout any anger :)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for not so great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter1023
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent but there are plenty of near by hotels that you could get a better deal. Two of the nights we paid 40 euros, rooms were very small, nowhere to put luggage without almost tripping. No windows!!! By paying extra 10 euros we got a window and a useless balcony and the room was still the same small size. And to get me started on the noise!!! The walls are paper thin!!!! We heard everything in the near by rooms and hallways every single night!!! We travelled for five weeks and that was the worst stay. When we complained about the noise the receptionist (bothe times and different people) just said oh sorry. Not worth it! Big disappointment from the pictures online.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel around the Region”
Reviews.Author: Baris_Ulk
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with helpful staff. This family run hotel provides you all the necessities you're asking for. Very very close to the historical site of Istanbul. It was good to stay in a clean hotel like this.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i have ever seen”
Reviews.Author: lika25
Reviews.Content: Do not go there. It is absoluely disgusting!!! Rooms are dirty, very small. It's more like hostel. It is certainly does not look anything like on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a very decent price”
Reviews.Author: makana22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Yes the rooms are very small, but who stays all day in their room anyway? We did have a window, but the view was of a wall 1 foot away. This was not a big deal to us, since we did not want to spend the day looking out the window. The room was clean, the shower was fantastic - great pressure and nice hot water, the bed was decent. The breakfast was plentiful with fresh cucumbers, tomatoes, eggs and yogurt - typical Turkish foods. We were lucky to have a table by the window in the breakfast room on the 5th floor. The staff at the front desk were all very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again and recommend this place. If you want a fancy hotel with a great view, dont stay here. If you want a good price and a decent room in a good location, then its perfect.

Reviews.Title: “simple hotel, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: bulentbektas
Reviews.Content: We have stayed In hotel Evsen for 20 days. The hotel is fantastic located in the middle of the Sirkeci district, nearby EminÃ¶nÃ¼. From the hotel you can walk in 10 min. to Sultan Ahmet, Topkapi, Grand Bazaar, Egypt bazaar, EminÃ¶nÃ¼ and to the faryboats. In one word perfect. The hotel is simple but if you just want to sleep and shower then it is more then anough. Good breakfast and flexible personel. Good service. I can advise you to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Olga2410
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Evset with my friend for 5 nights. Staff was very friendly, room was clean and everything looks very nice. It is very good 3 stars hotel I can add. The only one thing I didnt like rooms are very small! They are every small for one person, so about staying there together is really kind of difficult. Location is exellent, a few minutes of walking to all major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: marryannNY
Reviews.Content: During my trip to Istanbul, couple of my colleagues stayed at Hotel Evsen for a business trip. My stay there was amazing.The hospitality of the staff made me feel right at home and I was very comfortable. Everything was clean and well-kept. The place was also located very close to historic buildings and other places you'd want to see if you have the time to go sightseeing or shopping. The food in general was very satisfying, the cost of everything seemed very cheap in comparison. I would highly recommend this hotel to any one loking to make reservations.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for money”
Reviews.Author: SSD189894
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and is located in a popular and historic area. It's also very close to the tram station. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: maria_maus
Reviews.Content: Its a cute hotel near all important buildings in Istanbul. Everything was fine. I really like it. So friendly staff especially reseption personal like Mr Doruk. I recommend this hotel istanbul vnimaniye stariniyi vesi krasiviy ve harosiy vam otel skaju Sindy Wustman

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: bialystokka
Reviews.Content: An inexpensive hotel in a really good location.The hotel is only 10 minutes away to most important places.The rooms were so clean and the personnel were helpful. Michal Brudzinski

Reviews.Title: “An inexpensive hotel located in one of the most attractive areas of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SonjaJaJa
Reviews.Content: very good service (reception) small, but nevertheless clean, proper and nicely furnished rooms best location of the hotel for tourists (nearby the most famous spots in Istanbul)

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, but rooms is too small”
Reviews.Author: Wildcatcargo
Reviews.Content: Good location. Friendly staff. But too small rooms and very lack off breakfast. Very thin walls between rooms. Internet is free but very bad connection.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: valia1
Reviews.Content: last week i were there for the 3rd time in this hotel.... when u r going for business u need to stay at hotel evsen its very cozy and warm the rooms r ok a bit small but very comfortable the reception stuff there is very friendly and very helpfull and they speak english good abdullah on reception helped me so much and

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: arhLongIslandNy
Reviews.Content: The reception staff, Ertan, Abdullah are beyond amazing with their help and advice of where to go and what to see .The Hotel was situated close by attractions and the tram. The hotel is clean and simple. I needed a charger for my phone and they provided me with one for the week. While the street surrounding the hotel is not lit, there is always some one at the reception are no matter what time you come back at night. While taxis and cars are not accessible to the hotel you will have to have them pick you up or drop you on the street and then walk down to the hotel. I highly recommend a visit to Hotel Evsen Audrey from NY

Reviews.Title: “All you need for a city tour.”
Reviews.Author: BaanSuan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellently located for all of the old city including boat trips and restaurants. The staff are very helpful and polite. The rooms are rather small but have everything one needs. The hotel certainly made a very positive contribution to our enjoyment of Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great Value And Location”
Reviews.Author: EricF32655
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on a budget and got a lot for our money at Evsen. While the rooms are a little small, they are very comfortable and well appointed. Most impressive, though is the staff. Everyone was very warm and helpful. The breakfast is good and the coffee alone saved us tons of money as my wife drinks several cups a morning. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: umit353
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Evsen for 1 week and it was really really nice. Our room was deluxe double room with french balcony and we are totaly satisfied with the room; with its facilities and its cleaning!! Open buffet breakfast on roof restaurant is rich and nice. The staff is so friendly and polite to every customer. I recommend Hotel Evsen to anybody..

Reviews.Title: “stay in hotel evsen”
Reviews.Author: Fionse
Reviews.Content: All staff spoke english well and all of they are really helpful especially front desk .Breakfast was also imazing delicious... i will recommend this to hotel everyone who is going to visit Istanbul because the location of the hotel is in the heart of the city... rooms are comfortable and really clean...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: RoxBox
Reviews.Content: Very clean, service at the front desk was excellent. The staff spoke english well as again were very helpful. Rooms were clean, tidy and the AC worked well. The rooms were very affordable and had great value.

Reviews.Title: “''Perfect Istanbul Experience!''”
Reviews.Author: Maryiaa
Reviews.Content: It was overall a great hotel. The hotel is situated in the heart of city and the room was very clean and comfortable. The stuffs are very friendly and the breakfast was perfect. I'm looking forward to my next visit to Istanbul, and I'll certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bihter25
Reviews.Content: Evsen Hotel is in Sirkeci in a veri central location near to EminÃ¶nÃ¼ and Sultan Ahmet (blue Mosque). The Peole who are working there are very hospitably. The turkish Breakfast is very nice. The rooms are a little bit small, but taking in consideration that the prices for the rooms are very low, there is no problem about that. Thank you for the nice hospitation. Next time we will again go to even Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: larjuan
Reviews.Content: Except for location & friendly staff, this hotel has nothing to recommend it. Our room had no window, and was so small we couldn't open the door. There was no blanket on the bed, when we asked they brought a second sheet. Cramped and claustrophobic. Anything you might actually want for breakfast - eggs, toast, fresh orange juice - is surcharged and expensive. No rooftop view.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in the istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jack1905
Reviews.Content: when compared to other hotels hotel evsen has excellent location near to historical places and entertainment places at istanbul, services are good room was very clear the staffs are friendship, meals offered me traditinonal turkish meals. when i come to istanbul, i will stay the hotel evsen absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: nicky_cc
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Hotel Evsen. The room was comfortable and we didn't hear any hall or noise from other rooms. The location was very good and it was close to everywhere. The staff are very friendly. We were very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: bir_evs
Reviews.Content: The location is very good.The staff r helpful and good- humored also the buffet meal is good.We saw the hotel was very clean and we were very happy with the service we got.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and cosy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lalecik
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect! Just 5 min from such places like Aya Sofya, Sultanahmet mosque, Topkapi and others. The hotel is situated in a nice street (and doesn`t face the road) which makes the location even better and cosier. There r lots of restaurants nearby, which is also very comfortable, if u feel tired at the end of the day and dont feel like going out for long. The hotel itself is very nice too and designed by people of taste. The rooms r small, its true (as for me i have seen smaller ones in Istanbul) but, guys, u r not coming to Istanbul to spend 24 hours in ur hotel room right? :) Also ppl who want to have larger rooms must be ready to pay much more ... As for us our room suited us perfectly! It was nice, clean and there were all necessary things! So we were absolutely satisfied. The breakfast was good, too! And the staff was very helpful! So we want to thank the hotel for the nice accomodation and sure we will come to that hotel again! And I certainly will recommend this hotel to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but friendly service and grat location.”
Reviews.Author: Dazel_London
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early and they were nice enough to open the restaurant to serve us coffee. It was much appreciated. The staff were helpful and friendly and the hotel was very clean. The rooms are the smallest I've ever been in but I would still reccommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Evsen”
Reviews.Author: NinaOguz
Reviews.Content: + close to historical places (Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc.); + close to Galata bridge; + not expensive; + newbuilt; + have their own taxi service. - too small rooms; - windows are showing another building's walls (you can touch them from your room); - too noisy because there is a construction nearby; - A LOT OF turkish restaurants with annoying service ("Please come to my restaurant!!"); - clean but I've found other people's hair everywhere. If you travel alone and do not plan to spend a lot of time in hotel, it is a good place to stay for your first time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel which you can feel and live the Istanbul...”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoAdvisor
Reviews.Content: Hotel's loacation is in the heart of antique (historical) Istanbul. If you are looking for how was the cultural side of the Ottoman Empire and their fascinating buildings, lifestyles... This is the loacation that u should go to see and feel it. Also, different transportation types are linked you to current downtown. You can easily go and see skyscrapers and huge buildings with 1 or 2 buses... Hotel is really clean, and the staffs are really helpful to customers (at least to us :) ) And the last thing what about the hotel i loved is its design... It is totally awesome, very unique and different for us like from foreign countries...

Reviews.Title: “Never enter to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stayunderground
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in this hotel, actually i even dont want to name this place as hotel, in october. we choosed this hotel according to comments on tripadvisor and pictures from hotels website but unfortunately reality was much much much worser than comments on tripadvisor and pictures from hotels web page. When i asked why room pictures are so different than reality answer was a shock for me. As answer receptionist told me that this is marketing !!!! we have booked 3 rooms all of them were disaster there were no window no balcony even no sunshine in rooms and they were the most smallest room which i have ever seen. So i advise you people to stay far from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms, no windows, great location”
Reviews.Author: Teerex51
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of many Istanbul highlights. Unfortunately ,the rooms are incredibly tiny, many are windowless and (at the time of my visit in May 2009) air conditioning did not work in mine. Nobody among the staff could offer any guess as to when the a/c would be fixed, nor could they move me to another room as the hotel was fully booked. Although the room rate was very attractive, my room (and those of my friends) were not. I would happily spend 15-20% more for better accommodation in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff. Great service. Good location but room very small and basic.”
Reviews.Author: fedupofchoosingnames
Reviews.Content: Location is really good - just ten minutes walk from the main attractions and restaurants. Service excellent. Lovely staff who couldn't do enough for you. Breakfast was basic Istanbul fare - hard-boiled eggs, slices of processed meat, cheese, cucumber, tomatoes and olives and bread. Instant coffee and tea. Bring your own jam - theirs pours out like honey but that's the nature of jam in Istanbul! Very clean. Towels changed daily. The double room was a bit of a disappointment - it was VERY small. You could just manage to walk around the bed. Had a tiny wardrobe but only 3 coat-hangers. No chests of drawers. No windows. Had air-conditioning. Good power shower. Hair drier in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Location Okay, Comfort Rooms Can be Dungeon Like”
Reviews.Author: dawood83
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 comfort double rooms, in both rooms they gave us 2 single beds. Both rooms had windows that opened up to a wall (we knew this from before). One of the reception guys can be friendly but dodgy, tried to con us with shuttle bus fares. Rooms and bathrooms were small but one of the rooms (105) SMELT REALLY BAD and there was severe damp on one of the walls right next to the bad. Breakfast was not bad and the location was great - under 10 minutes to all the sights. Overall I would pay extra and not stay in this hotel (or atleast in these rooms next time)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: effemess
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days at the Hotel Evsen in Istanbul this September. We booked a deluxe double room with a small balcony. Although the room was small, it was exceptionally clean and comfortable. The hotel is very central for all the sights, only a short walk from the wonderful Istanbul trams. We found the staff excellent, helpful and kind. Breakfast was fine, although after 10 days a bit boring, but that was our problem. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Service and great small hotel with personal flair in the perfect area”
Reviews.Author: Danceation
Reviews.Content: We went for 4 days to Istanbul to visit a friend and the town. The Hotel Evsen is a very nice Hotel with very good stuff, very friendly and helpful. We felt very welcome from the first day. The area were it is, is perfect, because it's just some minutes to walk to be in the main area or to visit the moshees. The breakfast from the roof terrace in the morning was very nice. Very enjoyable. The rooms were clean and the price for the hotel is very good for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel with excellent facilities”
Reviews.Author: melaniehookuk
Reviews.Content: Excellent small hotel. This has been refurbished as many hotels in the centre of Istanbul have been. Thus our room was very new with tasteful decor ,very good shower, flat screen tv and small balcony.. It is true that the room was small and there was not a lot of storage space but we were there for three days only and felt it was much more important that the bed was very comfortable and that the linen and towels were sparkiling cleani in these days when many hotels can be dingy and grubby. The typical turkish buffet breakfast was varied and copioous. In particular the staff were very helpful and friendly. Having read trip advisor we specified a room with a window and would advise others to do the same An excellent budget hotel

Reviews.Title: “Would be a pleasure to stay in Evsen again!”
Reviews.Author: Cherrydr0ps
Reviews.Content: I`ve just got back from turkey a day ago and i booked with Evsen hotel in a twin Delux room. I went with my family,all together we booked 4 rooms.The rooms were incrediably clean and tidy, everyday the towels shampoos soap etc, would be replaced,great shower,hot and cold water continuously avaliable.the service was amazing,extremly nice people, helped us out organising daysout and advising us were to go.extremly helpful!! the area is perfect, a step away from the sea and the shops,surrounded by resturants. i would defentaly recommend this hotel to anyone, couples and families,i had a young sister who didnt even want to leave because the staff were so friendly. i would definatly go back to Evsen!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Levent_NL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Evsen is located in the very center of the historical Istanbul. The location is perfect,just minutes walk to many major sights in Istanbul where you find the famous monuments/buildings such as Sultan Ahmet, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Galata Bridge, Grand Bazaar, restaurants etc. Welcome at Hotel very friendly, helpful and informative staff, nice and clean rooms, service at the hotel was very kindly, The Hotel was very close to all interested places in Istanbul and can be reached either by foot, tram or taxi. Overall, a lovely place, friendly and helpful staff, comfortable clean rooms, good breakfast, minibar and free internet. We would stay there again and that is the best recommendation you can get! Great Location, friendly staff and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hiphip9
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our two-night stay in Istanbul in this hotel with its excellent location in the middle of an important historical district in Istanbul close to Eminonu and its accessible sea transportation. Plenty of restaurants close by and the bazar is only few minutes walk. The hotel was clean and I understood it had been recently renovated. Although our room was small but was enough to occupy my son and I with our luggages etc. I found the wall-mounted plasma television mounted a good credit for that hotel with its multi-language satellite channels mainly the BBC-world. The double-glazed French-door which opened into a balcony overlooking the street added an extra beauty to the room. Most important of all was the excellent rather helpful staff with faces full up with smile and welcoming remarks. I highly appreciate their great help in spending long time in making few phone calls and talking to the coach company we came with to Istanbul in order to locate my son's lost bag containing his camera and other valuables when they made a report in Turkish language on our behalf making plenty of phone calls which eventually led to finding the bag successfully. This service was offered totally free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest ever in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gbhasan
Reviews.Content: To be honest, my expectations regarding the hotels in Istanbul was not really so positive. I know the city is too crowded, and location of the hotels are not so well-distributed. On top, there is a real traffic problem there. That is why I really wanted to choice a hotel to stay with a great location, near to touristic places and easy to travel in - out. Then I booked a room from Hotel Evsen. First of all, the hotel is so well-equipped. Everything is in order, not only in the rooms but also in the bar, restaurant and hall. When you go into hotel, the environment is too friendly and warm. Smiling faces of staff and their friendly welcome make you think like: Ok !! I am at the right place !! The staff of the hotel are too kind and always eager to help you in all aspects. The rooms are so well-equipped and there are also furnished in a real modern and friendly way. You can find everything you need in the room. Especially the shower is real cool. No any problems with water and sink, which you can face with in every hotel. The room is also clean and room-cleaning service do their best. As I already said before, the location of the hotel is great. You can walk to lots of touristic places and no need to drive in crowded-traffic. That makes it perfect !! The breakfast of the hotel is also very nice. No need to mention the service, it is a real classic Turkish breakfast. I strongly advise everyone to book a room in this hotel. It is so friendly and well-constructed. Also when its price is considered, it is one of the best options you can have.

Reviews.Title: “You won't like it”
Reviews.Author: Jean8lee
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend this place after staying here in May 2009. If you reserve a room with the French Balcony, you will get a room without windows. It's not worth the aggravation. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “super time in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monikaaaaa
Reviews.Content: we stayed in hotel evsen wiyh my family and hotel was great, location was super, breakfast is good, rooms are clean, staff is so polite....very good meals:)

Reviews.Title: “the ali baba's cave with wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: anonimos41
Reviews.Content: The real situation about the hotel can not be compared with the site's presentation.The room was really tiny and not very clean.The breakfast nearly doesn't exist. The elevator broke down and we had the opportunity to work out.Although the staff was very polite and the location really good for immediate sightseeing. PS:Constractions were going on next door but we hope that is temporary.

Reviews.Title: “No Real windows and therefore no real Air, and no real Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: JungleFaceJake
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Istanbul last week, I was taking my mother on holiday as she has not been out of the country for 35 years. In march when planning the trip I trawled Tip Advisor for suitable hotels, and Hotel Evsen came out in my top 5 choices, not and it was really a matter of picking out of a hat, since all I wanted was a middling hotel with a nice standard of room, of course one would presume a window to the outside, and nice friendly staff. I chose Hotel Evsen as well because they offered a free Transfer from Ataturk Airport, which was great since I wanted the trip to be as stress free as possible, given the trip being a special treat for my mother and the fact that she walks with a stick and therefore I didn't want to be messing about with Buses or Taxi's on arrival. Our flight was delayed since we had to stop over in Budapest due to a fault with our plane (another story) and we arrived in Istanbul 5 hours late, but I had made contact and was very pleased that our transfer driver was waiting to greet us even after the delay, this was a very good start. Unfortunately that is as good as it got. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by friendly staff who were very quick to offer their set menu from the hotel restaurant, we were of course famished and duly accepted. The food was curious, but palatable, and we ate it up and enjoyed the relaxed feeling of the glass covered seating, looking out onto the tourist packed streets and the section of Istanbul skyline. so far so good. Then we got to our rooms, and they were small but seemed ok, and they said that they were the only rooms that they had next to each other. I didn't specifically ask to be next to my mother, but was pleased that they had made the effort to apparently make us happy. When I entered the room and felt the heat I immediately opened the window, it was to my horror that the window opened to a shaft that was pitch black and had Water pipes directly outside, at first I thought the heat was getting to me, so I put my head right outside the window to see if I could see the sky, no all I could see was pipes, humming to the sound of other peoples excrement running down to the sewer, which by the second day seemed as if it was specifically in my room. I complained to the Hotel staff and asked if at the very least they could move my mother since her room was exactly the same, and they said that they would do all they can to accommodate us, and to their credit they moved my mother to what they call a Deluxe Double, which means that it actually has a window that leads to the outside. in fact it had a French balcony which was nice and made me more comfortable with the situation. They told me that they may be able to move me the next night, but I decided to save the hassle and make do, even though my room had begun to smell of excrement as the drain was letting off the most acidic fumes, and it was not my doing as I may have eaten a lot of Kebabs and exotic Mezes, I generally spent little time in my own bathroom, and definitely not enough time to create a smell of that magnitude. The cleaners also didn't seem to be able to read the Do Not Disturb signs, even though they were written in about 10 languages, and they on two occasions entered my mothers room when she was in there, luckily for me they didn't attempt to get into mine (maybe lucky for them too given the heat and my lack of clothes when sleeping) I could go on, but I think you get the picture... On the plus side, There was one member of staff who was very accommodating and seemed genuine in his want to please and help, and his recommendations and hospitality were great and refreshing given that the rest of the staff fluctuated between painted on smiles and not giving a damn. One last thing, As I was unhappy with the bill when I was checking out I asked to speak to the manager and was informed that he was in Bed, Eventually the guy behind the desk called his manager who told his staff member that he would not speak to me and we would have no discount for our trouble. Eventually I got to speak to the manager who seemed completely disinterested and would not take ownership of a problem in his own hotel, I was disgusted by his tone and lack of professionalism, eventually we were given â‚¬25 off the total which we imagined would cover the transfer back to the airport. But instead we were given a minibus transfer, which would cost â‚¬5 per person, even though we had paid â‚¬25. All in all this place is a rip off, with horrible food and mostly miserable staff, most of the rooms have no access to air or day light and what they charge is disgusting given the conditions. On the plus side it is very well situated for the Trams and all the sites in SultanAhmet and surrounding areas. I would not recommend this to an enemy let alone a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: LeVoyageurdeLondres
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel a while ago when the Tripadvisor rating was in the top ten in Istanbul hotel category. I was surprised to see that it moved to the #90 before my trip, So I called them to make sure that I would get a window in my room (as I heard most of them don't). Once I arrived there, they told me that because they do not have any room with a window available they would offer me to stay at another hotel. They asked us to pay up front as that's how they proceed there (my mistake!). We then were taken to an 'ok' hotel, a couple of minutes away, but not as nice as Evsen looked on the website. We stillpaid 55 euros per night. On my way out of the hotel where I stayed, I asked the receptionist the price of a room and it was 45 euros. Basically, we were cheated 10 euros per night. All that with, of course, a big smile... I would not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “I have seen better hostels in Cambodia”
Reviews.Author: DanieleSB
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the most horrible hotels I have stayed in recently. The misleading website makes you believe that this is a little unpretentious charming hotel, but honestly I have seen many hostels that are much better than this dirty place. First of all, the hotel is undergoing intensive renovation and should not be open to the public in the state it is now. But even when the refurbishing will be finished, I seriously doubt this will ever been even close to what is advertised on the website. We were there for Easter and the problems started even before we arrived. The hotel offered an Airport transfer for â‚¬20, but what we actually got was a shared shuttle service with other passengers arriving with different flights. Since we were the first two to arrive, we had to wait at the airport for at least one hour until the other passengers arrived. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by a dodgy hotel manager speaking very broken English. The first impression was not good, but we thought it was mainly because of the renovation. We reached the room using a REALLY DIRTY elevator, but nothing could have prepared us for the shock. The room, or better the cell, was so small that there was just enough space for the bed. The walls were dirty (probably because previous guest kept hitting the walls trying to move around the bed) and the smell coming from the bathroom definitely not attractive. In the cell there was just a tiny little window that turned out to be a fake one which opened onto a hole filled with pipes. That was it. No natural air circulation at all. The bathroom was definitely small, with horrible and poorely fitted tiles. The toilet was stuck between the shower and a wall, the space was so small that it was honestly difficult to sit down. Given the tiny size of the bathroom, there was no room for a toilet holder, which was instead graciously placed in the bedroom. Sometimes we used to say: "I do not care if the hotel looks ugly as long as it is clean". Well this one was not even clean. The stairs and the lobby were disgusting, in part because of the construction work, but also because it looked like nobody could be bothered to clean. The room was a bit more decent, but still way below the average. In addition to this, the sewage smell from the bathroom really disgusting. Never mind, we went out for dinner and tried to have good time. Back to the hotel however, it was impossible to rest. Our room was placed right in front of a storage area where people seemed to work all night. The walls were so thin and the door so poorly insulated that we could hear every whisper. The best has been the wake up call of our neightbouring guests using the toilet in the morning - not a great start to the day. Needless to say, that even though we had three nights booked, we checked out the following morning. I would definitely not reccommend this place to my worst enemy. It does not even suit a young backpacker, as I have stayed in hostels much better and cheaper than this horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell , do not stay here.....”
Reviews.Author: JSSLondon
Reviews.Content: Mmmmm..... where do I start? Let's just say I have a lot to get off my chest! Let's start with the airport pickup service when we arrived from London. When charged EUR 20 for the service one would assume that you'd be collected and whisked off to your hotel, but no - we were kept waiting for nearly an hour whilst we waited for other passengers to arrive, who, incidentally were not even staying at our hotel. OK, not the end of the world we thought, but then we arrived at the hotel..... Firstly I have to say the website is thoroughly misleading, looking back I can't believe how duped we were. The look and feel of the site www.hotelevsen.com (at the time of writing) gives it the look and feel of a new, edgy boutique hotel. The dimly lit pictures.... and the "Our Rooms" preamble which now makes me laugh out loud...."Hotel Evsen is offering an extraordinary ambience with the architecture and the innovative design of 26 rooms." Let's break that down shall we.... "Extraordinary ambience" - yes it certainly was extraordinary to say the least! The hotel (hereafter called crack dungeon) was certainly in no fit state to be hosting guests, partially due to the construction going on upstairs, but more importantly due to the fact that it is not actually built to the standards of a hotel, or even a hostel for that matter. We were taken up to our room (I believe it was 404) in a dirty elevator, and before entering the room I noticed it was situated opposite some sort of random service area full of toilet paper and buckets, so I tried to remain positive and felt that perhaps this was all part of the boutiquey theme. Unfortunately that was not the case and we were led into what I could only describe as a chamber of horrors. The room was about as big as my suitcase (I exaggerate, but you get my drift), the bathroom had a simply stunning aroma of sewage which would not go away, oh and the view was breathtaking - and I mean literally breathtaking as the only source of oxygen possible was through this tiny window the size of a pin head (OK, it was slightly bigger, but you get where I'm going here), which opened up... wait for it... onto a series of water pipes! OK - we took a deep breath (close to the window to ensure we didn't get our noses burnt from the aromas emanating from the bathroom), and we decided, at least for that evening, that we would try and accept our predicament and enjoy the "architecture and the innovative design" (their quotes, not mine) of Hotel Evsen. So, we went out for a few beers and some fabulous food in the Taksim area. Whilst we were out and about I figured that a night in a Turkish jail or hospital would have been preferable to an evening in our hotel, so I did my very best to throw myself under a bus, or at least get arrested by the Turkish police, but to no avail. So, we returned to the crack dungeon, somewhat weary, however sleep was not going to feature highly that night due to the fact that the entire property is seemingly made out of paper machÃ¨. We could hear every single movement, not only of the elevator going up and down all night, but of every guest, every toilet flush, every voice. By 3am I thought I was going to kill myself, but thankfully sleeping tablets eased my pain. We awoke early the next morning to the sounds of our Swiss neighbour expectorating, and it was then that we realised that we had to make a swift exit. Even though we had booked for 3 nights, we hastily logged onto the wireless internet (the one positive thing about this hotel) and reserved a room at the The Lady Diana nearby which was double the price but a true saviour of our Easter weekend and our sanity. So, as you can probably gather from my review, I would sooner eat my own young than return to this crack dungeon of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Evsen has potential but I would for construction to complete”
Reviews.Author: TheBiffs
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and clean but the hotel is fresh and new and the location is good. Staff seemed friendly and helpful. But i think it would be better to stay here after the construction is complete on the hotel next door and in the hotel. Note: some rooms face onto a wall - we thought it would reduce noise levels, but the construction was loud and clear (and does not stop on weekends). The rooftop restaurant is under contruction so breakfast is served on fold up chairs and tables in reception. Breakfast consist of fresh bread, jam, cheese, tomato, olives, cucumber, pink polony, orange squash / cordial, pre made strong tea and instant coffee and powdered coffee "whitener". Fresh milk would have been nice. The hotel arranged us an aiport pick-up, who did not pitch (so i suggest you just catch a metered taxi from the airport - it costs less). The lift was out of order on arrival, no hot water on Saturday night and the heating did not work for 2 nights. The hotel staff did address each complaint quickly (most of it seemed to relate to the construction that was going on). Bathroom could do with a hook / shelf or something to place toiletries on towels on, as your toiletries have to go on the floor. Fresh towels are provided each day and the room was tidied nicely. Construction next door and on the rooftop restaurant does not allow you to lie in. So all in, I reckon it has potential, but for the moment, I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent service in this sweet and homely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Savtajeanne
Reviews.Content: Would stay in the Hotel Evsen every time I am in Istanbul Wonderful location near lovely park and all the main tourist attractions, mosques, museums and the greatest tram system. Gulhane tram stop right on doorstep. Have never known such friendly and helpful service, I lost my Passport and the staff and Sinan were SO great, Found me further accommodation for the following week, as I was unable to travel on. Hotel itself very good at an excellent rate, twin room v. pleasant with a good window and plenty of hot water etc., I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel despite the construction going on.”
Reviews.Author: TenandJohn
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights here in March 2009, the hotel itself seems to be undergoing some renovation and the room appeared to be slightly unfinished. Room size was quite small but was all that we needed for our stay. The bed was comfortable enough and the shower was pretty good. We only had one tiny little window that opened into a piping shaft so that was a little strange and made the room quite dark. The bathroom had quite a musty smell but that could be due to the works being carried out. Only thing that really bothered me was that we were told the construction would be from around 12-6 each day however the banging and drilling started at 9am and one of the nights we could still hear drilling after 8pm, but once this is all finished it will be fine. The breakfast was basic but good and the staff were great and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel”
Reviews.Author: gairlochloyal
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on previous reviews and the hotels website - beware!! The room we were give was tiny, it was a struggle to open the door as it was almost hitting the bed. The bed itself was pushed up against the wall at one side. There was very little storage space in the room and what little space there was in the room was taken up by our luggage. The room also stank of cigarette smoke despite it being a non-smoking room (there was an ashtray in the room). Also, there was only a tiny sliver of a window which opened up to the centre of the hotel and was blocked by pipework. Unhappy with this we asked to see other rooms. The next room we were shown had almost the exact same problems as the other, although you could actually get round both sides of the bed. However, the toilet seat in this room was broken and the shower leaked very badly onto the floor. There was also nowhere in the room to hang used towles and as there was no toilet paper holder, it was kept in the bedroom. Despite all this we thought it will do as it was a city break and we weren't planning on spending too much time in a hotel room - that was until we tried to get to sleep! We heard everything that happend in this hotel including every use of any toilet in the hotel. Needless to say this was not conducive to a good nights sleep so we done the right thing and checked out the next again morning. On a plus I will say the staff were very friendly and helpful and did offer us another room when we told them we would be leaving early. The location is also perfect 5mins walk from Aya Sofia/Blue Mosque 12-15mins to Bazaars.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, clean hotel for young couples (but not for vegan/vegetarian)”
Reviews.Author: sillybella54
Reviews.Content: We are a young, vibrant couple in our early 20s. We got our free pick up at the airport and it was great. We picked this hotel n stayed there for 5 nights because it was cheap and affordable in the low seasons; plus, it has free Wifi internet, which is crucial to my freelance work! But we wished we would have stayed 3-4 nights, because Istanbul wasn't so vegan friendly :( and yet a stressful city most of the times to newcomers!! CONS: * The breakfast was not so surprising. We are vegetarians/vegans so it's really difficult to eat in Istanbul. We only had cold pieces of breads with sour cherry jams and tea/apple cider (green) while the rest had buttery bread/bagels, boiled eggs, salami, salted cheese, tomatoes/cucumbers, and sour concentrated juices. * It was really noisy all morning-early afternoon due to construction (they are building a restaurant on the roof, I believe). It was all the hammering, drilling, and even buzzing onto our walls--it was annoying! But we got through the noises. But it was usually quiet in the evenings--except that since all hotel rooms have thin walls, we can still hear others coming to the elevator, or the next room. That was a bit of privacy invasion going on. *We had windows, but they are blocked by brick walls, with little light. It would be great if we can have views, but since there's construction going on, it might not be ideal. * We had a smoking room because the rooms with windows are intended for smokers, but the rooms without windows are intended for non-smokers. But we ARE non-smokers, so we still smell cigarettes under the front door. That was a bit frustrating, yes. *Since we came in the coldest month of the year, the heater sometimes shut down itself, and came back on few hours later. It's inconsistent, so you'd better wear something warm in pajamas or something like that in the room while the heater's out sometimes! There are pros about this hotel. It's budget wise, clean, new, and it has really functioning wifi internet. I had no problem with it, but if you are downloading something, it might slow your Internet down. The room is cleaned everyday. Nothing is stolen from our room, so that's great. The maid was nice, friendly and loud, that's how Turkish people are :) I really like their service and how reliable they are, despite their poor speaking English skills. It was certainly in a good, secluded location (very difficult to find if you're to ride a cab), for sightseeing and visiting the mosques and famous historical buildings, but honestly, for us, we are more like a city people, we like seeing how the city runs busily with cafes and young-mature people, restaurants, and shopping arena such as the Taksim Square. We would have stayed a hotel in Taksim Square since it's more vibrant than this hotel in Sikerci area. But it's near the tram (metro area), which is beneficial for us to ride on it, but we had to ride on it daily to Taksim Square (our favorite place to shop, eat out, and blend in). To be honest. I wouldn't return to Istanbul, but I would return to this hotel for budget-wise vacation somewhere else. I wouldn't recommend Istanbul for vegans or vegetarians (strict), but the service is great at the hotel. Friendly Turkish hotel staff, really great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Gorgeous Location!”
Reviews.Author: yektengel
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed very much staying in Hotel Evsen during my visit in Istanbul therefore I would like to thank you to all the staff once again. I will definetly stay at Hotel Evsen ,every time I visit the city. Stayed for three nights in this lovely & excellent hotel in February 2009. This beautiful hotel is located only five minutes away from all the historical places (like Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, amazing Blue Mosque and many others). The room was clean and very comfortable, very vell presented with quality interiors and with all the useful facilities as well. I must also point out that all the staff were very polite, friendly and most important very helpful. I was able to use my laptop in anywhere in this fantastic hotel, because of wireless internet facilitiy, which was great. Another good thing was beatufilly served open buffet breakfast,I strongly recommend to try turkish style breakfast to those who wants to visit this magnificent city. Overall, I would highly recommend this perfect hotel who wants to be staying close by to all historical places in a picturesque location.
